UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Stores user account information, excluding sensitive authentication data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the account was last updated.

role.description: Role of user, either admin, vendor, or customer.

VendorProfile.title: VendorProfile
VendorProfile.description: Stores detailed information about a vendor.

id.description: Unique identifier for the vendor, matching their Firebase Auth UID.

name.description: The legal name of the vendor company.

products.description: A description of products or services offered by the vendor.

status.description: The approval status of the vendor.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the vendor profile was created.

definition.description: Stores user account information. The `userId` parameter corresponds to the Firebase Auth UID, providing path-based ownership and simplifying security rules.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, matching their Firebase Auth UID.

definition.description: Stores vendor profiles. The `vendorId` must match the user's Auth UID, who must have a 'vendor' role.

params.name: vendorId
params.description: The unique identifier for the vendor, matching their Firebase Auth UID.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and simplifies security rules. User accounts are stored under `/users/{userId}`. This path-based ownership model provides strong isolation and simplifies access control. Vendor profiles are stored in a separate `/vendors/{vendorId}` collection, which allows for different security rules and data models specific to vendors. The `vendorId` also matches the Firebase Auth UID, ensuring that only the authenticated vendor can manage their own profile.
